newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Group forms for World Bank HK$1.0 bln bond.
newsitem.headline: Group forms for World Bank HK$1.0 bln bond.

text.p: A group has formed for the World Bank's HK$1.0 billion fixed rate bond due May 7, 2007, lead manager HSBC Markets said.

The 10-year bond was launched earlier today and priced and re-offered at par. It pays a coupon of 7.58 percent quarterly to yield 7.7982 percent annually, or 33 basis points over the 6.89 percent Hong Kong Government bond due January 2007.
Application has been made to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority to accept the issue as eligible for its Liquidity Adjustment Facility, or discount window.
The bond will be listed in the Hong Kong Stock Exchange.
HSBC Markets is the lead manager.
Co-lead managers are Chase Manhattan Asia, Merrill Lynch International and Tokyo-Mitsubishi International.
Co-managers are Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, DKB Asia, IBJ Asia, JP Morgan Securities Asia, Oakreed Financial Services, Societe Generale Asia and Union Bank of Switzerland.
